messages.author: Evan Stade
messages.text: I was expecting you to leave querySelectorAll and then loop over its contents. I guess this is OK too but it seems likely to perform worse just because of the alternating between searching and modifying the DOM.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/24 01:26:24, Evan Stade wrote:
> you probably want webkitMarginStart

Done.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
I suspect you're right.  Done.
On 2012/08/24 01:26:24, Evan Stade wrote:
> I was expecting you to leave querySelectorAll and then loop over its contents. I
> guess this is OK too but it seems likely to perform worse just because of the
> alternating between searching and modifying the DOM.

messages.author: jeremycho_google
messages.text:
On 2012/08/24 01:26:24, Evan Stade wrote:
> RTL support?

It's a bit tricky, since I'm using width (to get the ellipsis working).

Most likely we'll need to revisit this implementation anyways, since I don't know how much of this design is final, or yet approved by UX.

messages.author: Evan Stade
jeremycho_google
messages.text:
No longer needed.

On 2012/08/28 00:36:17, Evan Stade wrote:
> On 2012/08/24 02:20:29, jeremycho wrote:
> > On 2012/08/24 01:26:24, Evan Stade wrote:
> > > RTL support?
> > 
> > It's a bit tricky, since I'm using width (to get the ellipsis working).
> 
> why is it tricky?
> 
> html[dir=rtl] .thumbnail-banner {
>   left: auto;
>   right: 5px;
> }
> 
> > 
> > Most likely we'll need to revisit this implementation anyways, since I don't
> > know how much of this design is final, or yet approved by UX.
>
